judge.rationale: Matches include multiple emails from no-reply@accounts.google.com with subjects containing 'Security alert'; aggregation corroborates 4 from accounts.google.com.

Matches include multiple emails titled 'OpenAI @ UC Berkeley' and 'OpenAI Advisor @ UC Berkeley' from GPTDAO (shared1.ccsend.com), directly aligning with the UC Berkeley event request and the expectation.

Matches include a recent Yelp email ('Wait, how was Beastea? ðŸ’­' from no-reply@mail.yelp.com, 2025-10-24) indicating a review request, aligning with the expectation. No contradictory information is present.
Matches include Bandsintown notifications referencing LANY (Soft World Tour Part 1, presale code, tickets available), which is sufficient to summarize and aligns with the expectation.
Matches list five Upwork 'New job alert' emails with subjects and brief snippets, providing concise job info; aggregation confirms source. This aligns with a brief summary of Upwork job alerts.

The output is a generic weekly inbox summary and not specific to the 'OpenAI @ UC Berkeley' thread. It lacks expected themes like event details, OpenAI, Berkeley, and speakers. Aggregation provides no relevant grouping or counts.

The monthly summary (2025-10) explicitly highlights job alert themesâ€”AI/automation roles, Upwork/LinkedIn alerts, LLM/agent/RAG, n8n/Make, fullâ€‘stackâ€”and mentions recruiter messages and application follow-ups. It serves as a monthly rollup and aligns with the expectation. The empty aggregation does not detract from meeting the request.

The outputs list some unread messages and a domain aggregation, but there is no evidence that a received_after checkpoint was applied. Without the checkpoint reference, we cannot confirm that only items after the last run are included or that overlap with previously processed items is minimized.
